document.docAuthor: Bortolanza, Mariza, Carvalho, Claudio José Barros De & Lara, Ana Paula Conter
document.docTitle: Coenosopsia albuquerquei Bortolanza and Carvalho, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Coenosopsia Malloch (Diptera, Anthomyiidae) from southern Brazil and a reappraisal of the cladistic relationships of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Coenosopsia Malloch (Diptera, Anthomyiidae) from southern Brazil and a reappraisal of the cladistic relationships of the genus

heading.emphasis:
Coenosopsia albuquerquei Bortolanza and Carvalho
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species is closely related to
C. ferrari
but can be distinguished by surstili width, size of pregonite and aedeagus and by other characters provided in the key.

Male. Measurements: 2.29–2.98 mm (body length), 2.36–3.3 mm (wing length). Colour: frons dark brown on upper half; lower half orange­yellow. Ocellar triangle dark brown with silver pollinosity. Gena yellow with silver pollinosity. Palpus, proboscis and antenna brown.

Legs light brown, lighter at base of hind femora. Abdomen brown with yellow maculae at lateral apex of tergites 2–4 . Sternite 1 setulose with robust setulae. Terminalia (Figs. A–D): Epandrium in lateral view, with dense robust setulae at lower anterior portion. Cercal plate with downwardly oriented median lobe, tapering to a point at the apex. Surstyli elongate, left surstylus very slender. Pregonite with fine setulae on the anterior apex (
Fig. 2
A).

C. albuquerquei
and
C. ferrari
share fine setulae on the anterior apex of the pregonite, however these setulae were unnoticed in the description of
C. ferrari
(see
Nihei & Carvalho 2004
). Females cannot be distinguished from females of
C. ferrari
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–10. 1–4.
C. albuquerquei
sp. nov.
1. Cercal plate and right surstylus, lateral view. 2. Surstyli, dorsal view. 3. Left surstylus, lateral view. 4. Cercal plate and surstylus, dorsal view. 5–7.
C. ferrari
.
5. Cercal plate and right surstylus, lateral view. 6. Left surstylus, lateral view. 7. Cercal plate and surstylus, dorsal view. 8–10.
C. brasiliensis
.
8. Cercal plate and right surstylus, lateral view. 9. Left surstylus, lateral view. 10. Cercal plate and surstylus, dorsal view. (Scale bars: 0.1 mm.)

FIGURES 11–13. Male aedeagus and associated structures, lateral view. 11.
C. albuquerquei
sp. nov.
12.
C. ferrari
. 13.
C. brasiliensis .
(Scale bars: 0.1 mm.)

tr.td: to honour Professor Dalcy de Oliveira
of his valuable contribution to knowledge

paragraph.emphasis: Comments on habitat of the species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Some species of
Coenosopsia
are larviparous (
Michelsen 1991
;
Nihei & Carvalho 2004
), and in our sample, we found eggs, and no larvae, in one gravid female of
C. albuquerquei
.
